meanings.definition: In a manner that involves prying or snooping
meanings.sent1: She peeked snoopily through the keyhole to see what was happening inside.
meanings.sent2: He looked snoopily around the corner to check if anyone was watching.
meanings.sent3: The cat snoopily investigated the new visitor in the house.
meanings.sent4: The detective snoopily gathered clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The curious child snoopily listened in on the grown-ups' conversation.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to snoop or pry into others' affairs
meanings.sent1: The nosy neighbor snoopily watched everyone coming in and out of the building.
meanings.sent2: She had a reputation for being snoopily interested in other people's business.
meanings.sent3: The snoopily curious dog kept trying to dig up the buried bones in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her snoopily investigative nature made her the perfect candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: The snoopily observant student noticed the teacher's hidden smile during the test.
